name: Acasia, Sweet
desc: A common shrub or small tree with light green foliage.

name: Acasia, Wright
desc: This small tree rarely reaches a height of 30 feet or a trunk up to 12" in diameter.

name: Anacahuita
desc: A small tree with a curving trunk, to 20 feet tall and a trunk to 12" in diameter, with a low, rounded crown.

name: Anacua
desc: A medium-sized tree to 50 feet tall and a trunk to 2 feet in diameter, with a dense, round crown of dark green foliage.

name: Apes-earring, Ebony
desc: A thorny shrub up to a medium-sized tree, 40 feet tall and a trunk to 2 feet in diameter, with thick, spreading branches that form a dense, dark green crown of foliage.

name: Mexican Ash
desc: A medium-sized tree to 40 feet tall and a trunk to 2 feet in diameter, with a broad, densely-branched, rounded crown and branches that tend to droop towards the ground.

name: Ash, Green
desc: A large forest tree to 70 feet and a trunk to 2 feet in diameter, with spreading branches and an oval crown.

name: Ash, Mountain
desc: A medium-sized tree to 45 feet tall and a trunk to 2 feet in diameter, with an oval crown.

name: Ash, Prickly
desc: A small tree, seldom over 30 feet in height, with a short trunk usually under 12" in diameter.
